If there are situations where they are waiting for the staff, they should be waiting in the lobby. Only Escape Masters staff are permitted behind the desk in the lobby area and the storage room.

6@ Before staring the game.Birthday parties:
If there is a note in the comment section of the booking system that it will be a birthday party, please decorate the room. There are birthday decorations in the "party box" in the staff room.

We also offer to hide little presents in the locked box, so once they open a box, they not only find the clue, but the presents as well. People who request this service, must bring their present.

​​
6@ Before staring the game.Check the game level:
Check the level to make sure that the room is set up correctly. You will need to confirm the level of the game (and the game as well) before you put them in the room.

Make sure that teams play the appropriate level of the game. (2-3 pp = easy, 3-5 pp = medium, 5-8 pp = hard 8 pp or experienced groups = x-hard) Group of kids easy or medium.

For example, a group of under 14 years trying play on hard level. You know each room and you can talk to the players, so use your best judgment.

You will be playing on /Level/. The best time is /minutes/ on the level you will be playing on. 

If you think that they are not suited for the level they have booked, please advise them.
6@ Before staring the game.Introducing players to the game, game ru:
Escape Games

Not everyone has played an escape game before. Please explain a bit about the game to those people that have never played before.

Now I would like to explain to you a bit about the game. Escape Masters is an adventure, where teams are locked in a themed room and their common goal is to break out within an hour. 

To escape, you will have to use objects from around the room, find clues and solve puzzles! It is a room filled with brain teasers, tricky riddles, locks, keys and a lot of fun. 

Ask players if they have a strategy

Do you have a strategy?

Good strategy: Preparation, effective teamwork, communications, good organization, curiosity, modesty and good mood ☺ 

Bad strategy: You are late, you don’t pay attention, you want to solve everything by yourself, team is not communicating so everything is checked 3 times, you rush, you are impatient, you work on one problem for a long time and you forget to ask for help. 

Make sure that all the players have the rules and understand what they can and cannot do in the escape rooms. Please highlight what to do in case of emergency and how they can call you if they need immediate assistance.
6@ Before staring the game.Outdoor escape game:
Not everyone has played an escape game before. Please explain a bit about the game to those people that have never played before. Players have to search downtown Auckland for clues and puzzles to find out who the mystery bag belongs to. Would you be able to do it?

Please ensure that all the rules have been read. Make sure that they pay attention to traffic rules and have our phone number to call us in case of emergency.

​
6@ Before staring the game.Remote Play Escape Game:
​

Not everyone has played a Remote Play Escape Game before. Please explain a bit about the game to those people that have never played before

 

The Remote Play Game allows you to play our Escape Rooms virtually anywhere with your team. Your team gets to control the Game Master instructing them on what they need to do to help your teams escape! You only have 60 minutes to solve our rooms filled with brain teasers, tricky riddles, locks, keys and more!

 

Ask players if they have any questions.

​
6@ Before staring the game.Request for food and drinks:
People can also use our lobby for drinks and food.

They can buy our non-alcoholic drinks or bring their non-alcoholic drinks in.

We can also offer to help them organise food. 

We do not allow them to bring alcohol as we do not have the license to be a BYO place.
6@ Before staring the game.Show players where the fire exists are: When customers arrive staff should point out where the main fire exist is (next to The Legacy of the spy room ) when customers are in the lobby area.
6@ Before staring the game.Show players where the toilets are: Any one needs to use the restroom before? (If yes, please show them where the bathrooms can be found.)

7@ Starting the experience.Escape Game:
7.1.1. Getting players started with the tablet

Get a tablet and create the game session with her/his pin. Or use their personal QR code. Once logged in, it will take you to the Welcome view. At this stage you must hand the tablet over to customer group. They will be able to choose the language preferred before pressing “Let your experience begin” button.

Instruct the players to follow the instructions they see on the tablet and to fill in the necessary details (Team Name, Name and Selfie). Once submitted, player sign in page will come next.

There are three different ways to sign in:

1) With an account (‘Sign in’ button)

The customer can create an account to login (An email address is needed in order to create an account) Or she/he can use an existing account to login, Or she/he can use a social media account to login (Facebook)

2) Without an account (‘Register’ button)

The customer can create a one time visitor account by pressing the Check in button. The only mandatory field is the name.

3)‘ I Booked It ‘

The customer who created the booking can take legal responsibility for the whole team. However, all parties must be aware and must agree to this. This is more beneficial for larger groups. When this option is chosen, the customer taking legal responsibility must do one of the two options.

        -    Customer can fill out the customer information page and tick ‘returning customer’ and enter their password. Once completed they can tick the box on the bottom that allows them to take legal responsibility of the whole team. Once completed they can press submit to progress.

        -    Customer can fill out the customer information page and tick ‘One time’. Once completed they can tick the box on the bottom that allows them to take legal responsibility of the whole team. Once completed they can press submit to progress.

 ALL players are required to complete this, as it means that the players understand the rules and regulations. So please tell all the players that we need at least all the players’ name. However, it is highly recommend to create an account with us in the app, so we can send the their pictures and inform them of free games and other future deals. And please do not use any fake email address (just register as one time visitor)!

Tell the customers we will only send one email; we will not spam their inbox. This is because we mail them the pictures that we take at the end of the game and the selfies they take for free. Politely ask (encourage) them to put down their emails.
7@ Starting the experience.Escorting players to the game room, show:
Are you ready to start the game?  Check the tablet to see if the team has read the games rules, health and safety introduction, and escape room story. 


If this has not been done ask the team to please read these and tick all of the boxes once having read these. 


Are you ready to start the game? Please follow me.

Now take the team into their room, bring the tablet along and show them where they can put their stuff (in the black box).

Emphasize to customers that the cameras are there for security and safety reasons and so staff can see how you are doing in escaping the room. The cameras have nothing to do with the game so please leave them alone when you are escaping.

Explain how all clues are in the room, however there are no clues under the carpet, ceiling, wall, or the air conditioner, props, picture or decorations on the walls. So players can leave these areas alone because they will not find any clues there.  

Point out the emergency button in the tablet and doors. Show players how the emergency doors work and indicate to them where the closest fire escape route is. 

In case of emergency please use the emergency door or key or press the call button. 

If you hear the fire alarm, please stop everything and leave the room through the emergency door. Leave the building at the closest escape route and meet our team in front of the assembly point.

You must ensure that all players leave the room in case of emergency. 

Explain to players that they should not stand in front of the end exit doors of the escape rooms, especially the end exit door of Bank heist 1 and 2 . Because the players inside could hit anyone that is on the other side of the door when they are rushing to escape the room. 

For your safety please remember: 

DO NOT force things, everything can be opened with a combination. 

DO NOT climb on top of chairs. 

DO NOT pull the shelving / furniture on yourself or other players. 

Please be gentle with props and design elements.

Do not check behind the fake ceiling. 

Please do not disconnect the camera or the timer. We had a player disconnect the camera as he was running out time…no, this will not give you more time, so do not unplug the timer.

Be careful with trying digital combinations as if you get the wrong code multiple times, it will start beeping and will not be able to enter the correct code for a couple of minutes. 

Any questions?

​
7@ Starting the experience.Introducing escape game concept: ​Explain to the players what they will be doing. “You will need to direct the Remote Play Game Master to find clues, solve puzzles, crack codes and escape the room. There are multiple puzzles in the room and you can work on them at the same time … the room is not a linear setup.” You might want to point out a lock for the players, to show them what they would need you to open for them.​
7@ Starting the experience.Introducing players to the game rules:
Make sure that the rules have been thoroughly recited for the players and that they understand before starting the game. Ensure that you ask if they have any further questions before commencing.

The video must be turned on throughout the whole game, if it is turned off the game will stop.

No pictures, visual or voice recordings are to be taken throughout the game. Players can direct Game Masters to repeat themselves or to zoom in on certain objects.

Players cannot instruct the Game Master to complete any activity that may put their safety at risk. For example: Jump on the furnitures, tables, chairs etc

There is nothing in the ceiling or aircon

Games must start on time and will only be paused for valid reasons. 

During the game, no extra players are allowed to join.

​
7@ Starting the experience.Introducing players to the game rules in:
Ensure that all players read the rules and confirm it by checking the tablet. Please try to answer any questions that they might have regarding the game. 

Do you have any questions?
7@ Starting the experience.Introducing the story: Use the examples in the 7.1.6 section to help you introduce the story.​
7@ Starting the experience.Starting Remote Play Escape Game:
Click on your Google Calendar to view the games that you will be hosting. 

Click on the scheduled event and press the Google Meet link 10 minutes before the game starts. 

Recommendation for players

Politely ask the players if they need to use the restroom and if needed, to do so now as the game will take 60 minutes

Inform the players to put their laptop or device in use on charge to prevent any issues during the game

Check that the players are comfortable in their spaces and that they have everything that they need prior to the game

Inform the players to have a paper and a pen incase they want to take notes during the game

Explain to the players the process so that they are aware.

When we enter the room, I will explain the rules and story line. If there are no questions, I will start the timer and the Remote Play Game will start.

​
7@ Starting the experience.Starting the Outdoor quest experience:
Make sure that all the rules have been read and understood. 

Rule sheets are located on the wall of the lobby. 

Ask if customers have a camera with them as they need to take pictures for evidence that they went to specific places. 

Please check if the games have been reset correctly and then hand over the bag to the team. Offer umbrellas and sunscreen to customers.  

Make sure you check the time and let the team know that they have 2 hours now to complete the mission

​
7@ Starting the experience.Use of the Portal in the game room:
Explain to them how the app works. Tell them about the notes that they can make on the app. Tell them about the three clues they get during the game and how they can ask you to scan the QR code clues for them. 

Start the timer in the room.
7@ Starting the experience.Use of the tablet in the game room:
Explain to them how the tablet works. Tell them about the notes that they can make on the tablet. Tell them about the three clues they get during the game and how they can scan the QR codes for clues. Make sure to tell them that they need to scan the QR code outside the escape room after they exit through the locked door asap to record their accurate escape time.

Start the timer on the tablet.

“This tablet will stay with you in the room during the game. You can take down notes in this tablet. You get three clues during the game and can use them if you are stuck with any puzzle. Just press the tab (scan QR clues) and scan the QR code of the puzzle that you need the help with. Please make sure you carry the tablet with you when you escape through the exit door and scan the QR code outside the room to record your accurate escape time. This will also show you the team rank and if you are the fastest team of the month.”

​

8@ while customers are playing.House keeping:
Cleaning

Make sure while customers are in the game room playing, to go around the lobby area and tidy and clean the tables, rearrange and push in chairs, vacuum the lobby area if needed.

Also, at least once a week the escape rooms need to be dusted and cleaned this includes the skirting in the rooms. And in addition to this, each month the escape rooms need to be disinfected.


​
8@ while customers are playing.Monitoring players and giving help - Esc:
Monitor the players and watch them to make sure they are safe and not causing any harm to themselves or the property. Players normally ask for help through the tablet. Should they need any other help, they can call the staff with the emergency call button in the tablet.This button, which is located on the top right hand side, is called the ‘SOS’ button.

You need to go into the room and check what they need help with and enter your code in, so the help given is registered.
8@ while customers are playing.Outdoor Quest:
Please make sure that they are back within 120 minutes. 

If they are more than 10 minutes late, please give them a call to make sure that they are safe. Give them help on how to get back to Escape Masters.

There are no clues given to players during the quest.

​
8@ while customers are playing.Remote Play Game:
Please make sure that the teams are done within 60 minutes.

If they are more than 10 minutes late online, please give them a call to make sure that they are still attending their Remote Play Game or if they need further assistance.

 

Throughout the game, the entry door must be closed at all times.

 

Before you start the game, you must get into character when telling the teams the story. You must tell it correctly and during the game link back the puzzles and clues to the story so that the players can understand.

 

If the players are not instructing you to complete a specific task, you will need to circulate and browse the room slowly with the camera. Make sure that you avoid mirrors or anything that may reflect your reflection so that the players do not see you.

 

When entering a new room, you must announce the name of the room and describe its layout so that the players are aware. We are now in the Server room which is a small room.

 

You will need to direct the camera so that it shows everything in the room, elaborating on anything that is relative to the room that may help the players. If there are doors in that room, you may need to describe how it opens or what you may need to find in order to open it. To my left I can see a vent with two 3 digit locks containing two identical pictures of a T tool on the top and bottom. We might need to find this tool as it might help us open the vent?

Facing forward there are some computer board buttons that the Alien’s use. On the windowsill there are a handful of black pipes and one red wire. On the right hand side there are some computer parts that are labeled “Props”. Below on the ground, I can see a squared section, maybe we can open it?

 

If the players have found a compartment or door that needs to be open, you must explain what it is and how it can be opened.  This tool box is locked with a 4 word letter lock, we need to find a four letter word in order to open this tool box. 

There is another door in this Corridor that is locked with a Sensor button next to it? Maybe it is a sensor door?

Provide the players with as much information that they need in order to get them into a flow without revealing too much information that it ruins that game for them. Allow the customer to find the next step without spoiling it for them or giving them the answers.

 

If there are objects in the rooms that are not related to the players game, you will need to inform them to prevent confusion. For example, Hard or Masters Level puzzles or signs. Just to inform you, this puzzle is not applicable to your level or this sign says this puzzle is only Hard or Masters Level.

Throughout the game, you will need to show the Players everything. For example, the players will need to see the exact code you are entering into the lock. No cheating is allowed. 

 

Throughout the game, you will need to be interactive with the players so that they understand the puzzles, room and overall game. Good job team, did you guys enjoy that puzzle? Was it challenging enough? .. Now we have quite a few things left to solve. We have a safe that we have not used and a few objects that we have not investigated. What object would you like to investigate first? 

If you sense that they are stuck, ask them if they would like you to elaborate further on a specific puzzle. You can also remind them that they have 3 clues that they can use. However, you cannot force them to use a clue or to do something that is unreasonable.

 

Throughout the game, you will need to inform the players about their progress and status of their game. So far, we have solved the hierarchy puzzle which opens the hierarchy puzzle box and has given us another battery. Currently, we have one more box to open and three rocks that we have not used. 

 

Throughout the game, you will need to actively announce the countdown time informing the players how much time they have left to play in the room. Just a heads up team, we currently have 30 minutes left, 10 minutes left, 3 minutes left, 1 minute, 30 sec ..

 

Resources for the Remote Games

To conduct a Remote Play Game, the Game Master will need to use a Tablet and their personal phone for the time being till the phones for the game are purchased. The tablet is needed to recite the rules, story line, start the game, scan the codes and finish the game.

 

The Game Master must use landscape mode during the games along with the headset. It is important that the devices are fully charged and that there are power banks within arms reach if needed during the game.

​

9@ Congratulating players.Escape game:
​If the players finish in 60 minutes:

Make sure when the team escapes, they scan their QR code. Let them check their ranking. Congratulate them and ask: how was the game? What did they like? 

Are they interested to find things that they have not or solve puzzles that they were not sure about? – in this case show them the clues and how to solve these puzzles.
9@ Congratulating players.Outdoor quest:
Make sure the teams get back on time. Congratulate them on their performance. Check the Evidence Submission sheet and count their points. 
The answer sheet is located in the side desk second draw near the fridge.


Simply add together all the points for all the correct answers. Announce the results and congratulate the winners. Staff member needs to rip up the answer sheet that customers used and bin it after showing customers what their score was.
9@ Congratulating players.Remote Play Escape Game:
If the players finish in 60 minutes:

Make sure that when the team has escaped, that you scan the QR code. Let them check their ranking. Congratulate them and converse with them about their experience, out of the room and in the lobby, and ask: how was the game? What did they like, if they have any suggestions? How can we improve?

10@ After congratulating players.ERMA Survey for customers to complete:
Once players have finished the Escape Room ask customers if one of them or a group if they can please do a quick survey on their Escape Room Experience. The survey is to be done on the same tablet that the team has used in the Escape Room to scan QR codes etc with. 
Once customers have filled out the survey, thank them for taking the time to complete the survey. Staff need to check the customer's review through ERMA on one of the computers after they have sent their ratings.
If the rating is below 5, especially if the rating is 3 or below. Then that staff member needs to ask the customer/s why and how they can improve. Reasons for not getting a 5 rating needs to be recorded in the notes section of ERMA. 
If the customer/s who gave the low rating have already left then the Manager on duty needs to call the customer and ask what went wrong with their escape room experience and how we can improve.  
Assess the customer's review and if staff have been given below 5 for staff attitude. If this is the case, Operations/Production Manager must discuss this with his/her team to determine how they can improve upon their attitude towards customers in order to not fall below 5 in the survey in the future. This also needs to be done for all components of the survey in order to obtain all 5’s.
Relay any important feedback to directors so the entire experience can be improved.
10@ After congratulating players.Taking photos of players and uploading p:
Ask them if you could take a picture of the group. If you can take the picture, select the group that you will take the picture for on the tablet. Take the picture on the tablet. 
Confirm you would like to use this photo. The details of their team name and finish time will be updated on the Tablet, website and social media automatically. 
Please do not show much of the room and none of the clues should be in the picture. People are allowed to take some props to take pictures with. You must take a good picture of the team. A good picture is not blurry, set in the correct background, sufficiently bright, and it does not show any clues of the game. 
After taking the photo, key in your PIN or scan your QR code to confirm that you have received the device after the game.
For the Outdoor Quest team photo, grab the Escape Masters photo frame. Ask the team if they would like to take the photo in front of the whiteboard or the red wall 
“Our great moments”. Take the photo with the iphone and upload the Outdoor Quest team photo to Facebook under the relevant Outdoor folder.

11@ Additional game sales.Additional game sales: You will need to check if they would like to play another game or you could make a booking for a future game now.
11@ Additional game sales.Promoting Remote Play Escape Game: After the game please ask the customer to review the game if they had a good experience. “Once again, my name is XY and I was happy to host you today. Did you enjoy the experience? Why not review the game and the staff on TripAdvisor and help spread the word? Let other people enjoy this game as much as you did! We would greatly appreciate it!”

12@ Requesting social media review.Requesting social media review: After the game please ask the customer to review the game if they had a good experience. “Once again, my name is XY and I was happy to host you today. Did you enjoy the experience? Why not review the game and the staff on TripAdvisor and help spread the word? Let other people enjoy this game as much as you did! We would greatly appreciate it!”

13@ Saying goodbye.Saying goodbye: Please ensure that you say goodbye to all the customers and encourage them to come back. “Thank you for playing and hope to see you again!” You will need to mention our other branches as well.

14@ Resetting games.Escape game:
Once a game has finished, the tablet used must be used in its respective room. This is the tablet that the staff member has to use when resetting the room. Check in the booking system what level the next group will play on. Reset the room according to the booking system. Use the official game room reset manual to reset the rooms. Game rooms are reset correctly if they are in the correct difficulty-level indicated in the booking system and comply with the guidelines in the official game room setup manual.
The person resetting the room must time themselves using the app on the tablet for that specific room. The staff member resetting the room must start the clock on the tablet  when the room resetting preparation is taking place. The clock must be stopped once the room has been reset. 
Staff will be able to make notes of any issues that is identified in the rooms, e.g. broken locks, missing puzzles or when something has been replaced by you. 
Once the room is reset double check if everything is in its place and all the locks and the escape door is locked and the timer is reset as well.

15@ Changing game setup.Changing game setup:
You can deviate from the game room setup manual if there is reasonable need to change the game room setup, but you must ensure it adheres to the game's logic, fits to the theme of the room and the game is playable i.e. all the clues can be solved and players can escape.
Record any change in the Change Log located in the Shared sheet.

16@ Cleaning and maintainance.Cleaning:
The game rooms and the lobby must be clean at all times. Make sure the rooms are dust free and clean. If this is not the case, please clean up with the cleaning materials from the lobby and vacuum clean. Regularity of cleaning should be on a as-it-needs basis. 
Please do not close Escape Masters without making sure it is clean.
There is a weekly roster for cleaning the staff room / store room,

18@ Managing customer queries.Managing customer queries in Freshdesk:
https://escapemasters.freshdesk.com/a/dashboard/default
Please log in everyday and monitor the emails.
Type into browser: escapemasters.freshdesk.com/agent. Use your login details to log in.
Once you logged in…
 1st login:
Click on getting started tab.
Solve your first ticket – watch the video.
Ignore ‘create a view’ and ‘macro’
Everyday use:
On the left hand side, you will see the tickets. It is under the view menu.
You do not need to assign a ticket unless you cannot solve it. If you cannot solve it, please assign it to Lilla.
To view a ticket, click on it.
Read the ticket.
Type your reply in the “Public Reply” box.
You can attach a file, by pressing the attach file icon.
Once you are ready to send the ticket (email), submit it by the ‘submit’ button. You must select ‘Open’, ‘Pending’ or ‘Solved’ when you submit the ticket. If you select any of these an email will go out.

New = If you select this, the ticket will stay as new in the list, although you have replied to it. PLEASE NEVER SELECT THIS!
Open = It will show that one of us is already working on the email
Pending = It will show that we are waiting for request or reply. Please use this if you reply to a customer BOOKING QUERY and you have not made the bookings for this group. Once the booking is made, email the customer and change the ticket to closed.
Solved = It will show that the ticket has been solved. Don’t need to take action it. Please select this if you answer all the queries and if booking is needed you have made the booking.
Please revisit pending tickets.

Check pending tickets that are a week old (or older)
Call the contacts for the pending tickets. Ask them how you can help to make the booking.
Ensure once a booking is made relating to a ticket, you change the status to closed from pending.
You can search for closed tickets in the ‘recently solved ticket’ view.
You can search for a person with the search button.
You will need to use the refresh button to refresh the page and get new tickets.

Sample email:
Dear XY,

Thank you for your interest in Escape Masters!

Escape Masters, New Zealand’s first real-life escape game, is a new team building activity, where teams are locked in a themed room with a unique mystery, and all the participants must work together to solve the brainteasers and tricky riddles, open locks and find keys to escape the room within an hour.
This internationally popular phenomenon promises a vivid experience where you and your team can become the main characters of a captivating mystery.
This game requires critical thinking and tests your mettle on other important skills you and your team need in life in a fun and exciting environment. You will need to build a strategy, plan your moves, manage your time, share the work and cooperate. 
You will also need to think outside of the box, be creative, be innovative. The rooms have been designed to build genuine connections with the participants from the same or different teams. And for competitive groups with 4-16 players, you can pit two teams against each other by starting the teams simultaneously in our identically-themed rooms.
Escape Masters is the perfect place for your company, whether it’s to clear the air, or as a booster to revitalise your workplace relationships at your next team event. 
We offer four difficulty levels for our six rooms, and they can all be accessed in one convenient location in the heart of Wellington City. You can be certain your fun won’t be spoiled by the weather; we open rain or shine from 10:00 am to 11:00 pm every day of the year. Each room can have a maximum of 8 players in them, which means you can have up to 48 people playing at once. 
Arranging meals for your function will be easy and we also offer a wide selection of non-alcoholic drinks at a very friendly price. 
Our spacious lobby area is available for drinks and food, and your team is free to warm-up or cool-down there before this sensational challenge.
Rest assured, there is an emergency exit in each room, so it’s perfectly safe and no one will jump out to give you a fright.
[For more specific information on pricing]

The prices vary depending on the number of players in a room, but will range from $25 -$38. With a group of x players, it would be best to book Y rooms with x, x and x players. A room with X-X players will come to $X per room, therefore X rooms will come to $X.

Suitable for all ages, Escape Masters is the perfect venue for corporate functions, so don’t miss out on the best and the most unforgettable team building experience in Wellington!
We would love to have your team here at Escape Masters. Feel free to get in touch if you would like to have more information or would like to book your next team event with us.

Please find our flyer attached.

Kind regards,
XY

20@ Invoicing.Refund:
Escape Masters refund policy:
Once a game is paid, no refunds are available.
Customers will not be refunded if they are refused an entry due to being under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
Customers will not be refunded if they are removed from the game because they did not act according to the game rules, and/or they were at risk to others, and/or their behaviour was inappropriate according to the Escape Masters Team
However, in some cases we might give a refund. All refunds have to be approved by the Manager or one of the Directors.
Escape Masters refund process:
Investigate why a refund is needed 
Check the amount
Request approval for refund from Operations Manager or one of the Directors
Establish if cash or bank transfer refund is needed
If bank transfer refund is needed, please take the bank account number of the customer
Do not change the number of people in the bookeo as it will change the Xero invoice too. The customer already paid for 6 people, so we need an invoice that reflects the payment. Leave the number of people as is in Bookeo. For Ex : a Booking for 6 people but only 5 turn up. You give a refund for one player, create a credit note in Xero for the refund, and do not change the number of of people in bookeo. Mention the refund in the Bookeo notes as well. 
Create a credit note for the refund:
Cash refund: 
Select New Credit note
Fill out all the fields
In the reference field enter the invoice number that you are giving a cash refund on 
then press “approve” 
Fill out the amount credited and from which account (sales). 
Press save. 
Fill out the details for “make a cash refund” – Paid from field is (Wellington/Auckland/Rotorua Cash) 
Press add refund. Do not press allocate a credit note.
Bank transfer refund: 
Select New Credit note
Fill out all the field 
In the reference field enter the invoice number that you are giving a cash refund on
Fill out amount credited and from which account (sales)
Press save. Do not press allocate a credit note.
If bank transfer refund is needed, email credit note, and reason for refund to both of the Directors.
If a bank transfer refund is needed, inform the customer that the refund has been approved and it will shortly be credited to their account.

21@ Depositing money.Depositing Money:
At the end of every round of games if there is more than $200 in the cash box, and if there are no customers, you should deposit cash from the cash box into the safe in storage. For safety purposes, money should be counted in the store room and not in plain sight where customers or the public can see it. There should only be a maximum of $200 in the cash box.
Please check the amount of money in the safe and the cash box at the end of your shift. You should only leave a maximum of $200 in the cash box and $1000 in the safe. 
Please deposit any excess money from the safe into the ASB bank account during the day time.
Please ensure that there is enough from each note and change can be given from it. If there are not enough coins, please go to the bank or a store to exchange a note for coins.
All excess change should be placed in the safe.
How to deposit money at the ASB ATM: 
Take the money and the dark grey ASB deposit only card to the ASB bank next to 300 Queen street entrance. 

Insert the deposit card like a normal eftpos card however you can only deposit money into the account. Enter the pin code for this card which is Bela’s birth year. 
Select the cheque account to deposit the money in. Insert the cash into the machine. Confirm the amount deposited. Type your name as the reference so the directors know who deposited the money. Retrieve the deposit card and receipt and place it back into the safe. 

Depositing Cheque: 
Take the cheque to a teller at an ASB Bank next to 300 Queen Street.  Give the account number to the teller: 12-3066-0499995-00 and also give them the cheque.

22@ Opening and closing the branch.Closing:
Check the phone for any missed calls or messages and return the calls.
Check the iphone for any text message enquiries from customers, return any text messages.
Check Freshdesk for tickets and attend to them.
Check Bookeo for any Online games the next morning during the 7 and 8:30am time slot. If there are no games, block out these time slots. Contact the Production Manager or Operations Manager to complete this if needed.
Charge tablets, phones, iPods, batteries and any other items that need to be charged overnight.
Record any broken object/ equipment into the ERMA Maintenance list.
If there is an issue with fixing any object/ equipment then staff needs to let the owners know. 
If the broken object/ equipment needs to be seen immediately and it is the end of shift. Leave a note on the desk for the next production manager who will be opening the following morning and also assign the broken object/ equipment through ERMA maintenance list to the manager who will be opening. 
Turn off electrical puzzles, the TV and lights.
Closing count out of the cashbox, if over $200 it needs to go into the safe.
Put receipts from the whole day in the second sliding drawer beneath the cubby holes.
Make sure that the drinks fridge is full and all the drinks are at the front, nicely aligned.
Refill the flyer holder if necessary.
Log off and shut down the Lobby computers, the VR computer, and just log off the bank heist room computers. 
Rubbish bin emptied and a new bag is placed in the rubbish bin.
Ensure that Escape Masters is clean and tidy for the next day of business.
Put away the cash box on top of the safe in the storage room and lock it.
Turn off the lights in the lobby before closing up. Last light to turn off is in the hallway. 
Close the doors and make sure all of them are locked (storage and main door).
22@ Opening and closing the branch.Opening:
Arrive 15 minutes before your scheduled shift. Arrive at 10:00am if there are no games in the first round.
Turn on the lights for the lobby. (Lights for the rooms should be turned on before a game.)
Check in through Flexitime.
Unlock storage door.
Turn on the computer and log in. Bring the cash box out of the storage room.
Make sure that Escape Masters is ready to have customers: clean, EFTPOS is on, the timer is set, music is on and everything is in its place. Make sure items that are charging outside of the room are placed back in the room. Turn the air conditioners on.
Check if the rooms are set to the correct level, objects in the room are in their correct place, safe and all the locks are closed. And close the doors.
Count cash and drinks. Recorded in Google sheets.
Check the count sheet for the safe total from closing the previous day to see if there is money to deposit at the bank, as money in the safe should not exceed over $1,000 at closing . 
Make sure that the drinks fridge is full and all the drinks are at the front, nicely aligned, and the ice cream (Auckland) is nicely presented with ice creams at their correct place.
Refill the flyer holder if necessary.
Check the phone for any missed calls or messages and return the calls.
Check the iphone for any text message enquiries from customers, return any text messages and continue to do so throughout the rest of the shift. 
Check Bookeo for any outdoor quest games for the day and print off the necessary documents needed for the bag that customers use. 
Check Freshdesk for tickets and attend to them.
Check ERMA for assigned maintenance issues that need to be completed during shift.

23@ Assisting new game design.Assisting with new game design and creat: Please let the directors know of any ideas you might have. Attend team meetings and help brainstorm for the creation of new rooms or room changes.

24@ Managing PAs.Managing Production Assistants:
Make sure the Production Assistants arrive on time and wear their uniform.
Ensure that Assistants follow the processes and complete their responsibilities, as set out in the Responsibilities and work instructions - Production Assistant document. 
Inform Operations Manager or Directors of any issues with Production Assistants. e.g. Not turning up for their shift, not resetting fast enough once they have learnt the rooms.  
Training new Production Assistants :
Print the "Trainee sticker" and ask the assistant to stick it on their uniform.
Take assistants through the resetting of the Escape rooms, show them tips and tricks on quickly resetting a room. 
Test assistants on the resetting of the Escape Rooms till their knowledge and skill is to an acceptable and competent level e.g. Assistants can reset the room within the Escape Master maximum reset time that is less than 10 Minutes and score at least 90% on the written test on the Escape Rooms. 
Improve the customer service skills of the Production Assistants if needed, by showing how to greet a customer, give them the tablet, start a game, give help of congratulate them after the game. Ask them to observe you, follow-you and learn from you. Once you feel that they have grasped it, please test them by letting them to do these tasks and give feedback to them.
Ensure that the photos they take are good quality. If needs improvement, point out to them how the photos can be improved. Check if they have learnt it and give more feedback if needed.

27@ Managment aspects.Cash purchases: All invoices must be scanned and sent to Bela. However, if money is taken out for any purchase of Escape Masters, you must scan the invoice right away and send it to marta@escapemasters.co.nz
27@ Managment aspects.Customer complaint handling:
It is vital to handle customer complaints well. You can receive a customer complaint in person or in writing. All verbal and written customer complaints must be dealt with as soon as the complaint is received. Please follow the below guideline to best handle the situation.
You will need to handle all customer complaints in a professional manner. You will need to have a customer-first attitude and handle all complaints in this manner. 
Keep calm: Remain in control of your emotions, stay calm and professional. 
Listen to the customer: Allow the customer to explain the issue in detail, without interruption.
 “I see; could you please explain the situation to me in detail?” Get as much information as possible, so ask questions if the issues are not clarified for you.
Acknowledge the issue: Make the customer aware that you understand the situation. “If I understand you correctly ....(restate the problem here).” 
Apologise or explain misunderstanding: If you or any of your teammates have made a mistake, apologies for it. “I am really sorry about the situation.” If it is a misunderstanding, please respectfully explain the situation. “I can see how that would be frustrating for you. (now explain the misunderstanding)”
Offer a solution: Please keep in mind Escape Master’s policies when offering a solution. Offer an appropriate solution to the customer and let them know what you will do. “Based on the details of the situation this is what I can offer to you / this is what I will do…”
Check solution with the customer: Once a solution is offered, check with the customer to see if they are happy with the solution. “Would you say the solution proposed would work for you?”
Thank them for their cooperation: After you have offered a solution check with the customer if they find the solution appropriate. “Thank you for understanding and we hope to see you again!”
Act upon the promise: Take ownership of the issue and make sure you act upon what you have promised. 
Inform the team: By informing the team (incl. manager and directors) you are allowing us to review the situation and implement better processes for the future and learn from the mistakes, so they are not repeated again. 
Follow up call: Please call the customer to follow up on the situation and check if they are happy with the solution.

28@ Handling customer concerns.Compensation:
You will need to use your best judgment as to how to compensate a group. You may only need to apologise to them or promise that our process will be changed. However, sometimes a little bit more is needed. You can give a discount for their second game or give a free game to the group.
A free game could be given for compensation if a game was significantly incorrectly set up and it ruined the experience..
You will need to record any compensation given in the Shared sheet’s Customer complaint tab.

2@ Meeting and greeting players.Escape game:
At all times greet all the players with a big smile and go through the following points:
Welcome /Team Name/ to Escape Masters! My name is <XY>.
Have you played an Escape Game before? Live or online? If they have been here, what game did they play and how do they like it? Do you have any strategies for the game?  - converse a little on this topic. If they have not played a game before, explain about the game. An internationally popular phenomenon, where teams are locked in a themed room with a common goal to break-out. You will need to find clues and solve puzzles that are in the room to be able to escape within an hour. We have 6 rooms and 5 experiences. 
Introduce our other branches. We have branches in Manukau, Auckland, Rotorua and Wellington.
2@ Meeting and greeting players.Outdoor Game: Welcome to Escape Masters! Have you played an outdoor game before? If they have, please ask them how it was. Then tell about our outdoor game. Players have to search downtown Auckland for clues and puzzles to find out who the mystery bag belongs to. Would you be able to do it?

Creating a roster template on Flextime:
Start by creating time entries for the specific week for the team members by pressing the Record Time button on the Time Entry tab. Alternatively, team members can do this themselves. 

To create the final roster, you need to save the roster template for that specific week. Press the Options button on the Time Entry tab followed by the Save Roster Template. Next to Name, you must enter the roster details & press the Save button. For example: Roster for the week 23 April 2020 


 
To continue / finalise the roster, you need to press Load Roster. You will need to find the roster template that you were working on. Once located, double click on it & it should expand on the time entry sheet.

 
You can continue to edit the roster to reflect your roster plan. 
Team members can only add their availability to Flexitime. You will delegate who will be PM in the morning & evening & which PA will be 3 or 5plus for a specific shift. 

Once completed, press the Save button. 
Quick tips:
If you press ctrl & press the time entry, you can drag this to add the same time entry to another team member. 
If you want to add time on a team members entry, you can move the mouse over the beginning of their shift or the end & drag it to the left or right depending on whether you want to add or take time off.

 
You can filter the roster to only show the availability of a specific team member or role by pressing the Options button on the Time Entry tab. Below on the left hand side you will see the options of Filter Employee or Filter Work.
You can also filter the roster to see who has not put their availability up by ticking Show Employees Without Time box in the Options tab.

 
Once you have completed the roster, you will need to complete a final check to ensure that there are team members rosterd each day for example, at least two PM’s working in a day and that there are PA’s. There are 2 methods to completing this:
Method 1: Next to the Time Entry tab is the Summary tab. It summarises the rostered hours for each team member per day and overall through that specific week. 
Below this, you will see the Headcount. If the roster is created correctly with all the elements of the checklist (below) entered correctly then the overall pattern should look neat & perfect. If it is not, it will look squiggly.  If it is squiggly, go back to the Time Entry tab and check the shift.
Method 2: You can go through each day manually cross checking using the checklist below.
Checklist:
Morning Start times for PM’s are 9:45am & for PA’s are 9:50am
Closing times for PM’s & PA’s during the week day are 10pm and on Friday & Saturday nights are 11:30pm
Shift swap times for both roles during the day are the same. For example, 
Morning PM: 9:45am - 4:30pm
Evening PM: 4:30pm - 10pm
Throughout each shift (morning & evening) that there's one of each shift category (PM, PA:3 & 5 plus)
 
After your final check, if you are happy with the final outcome, you will need to email Bela & inform him that the roster is ready to be reviewed. Bela will complete the final checks before sending it out to the team.
38@ Flexitime.Submitting availability to flexitime:
Each week the deadline for submitting your available hours to work is every Wednesday  by 11:59 PM. 
This must be done each week before the deadline time and anything after the deadline will not be added.
How to submit your available hours:
1) Log onto flexitime
2) Click on the calendar and choose the date that you are putting in your availability for
3) Click on record time 
    - Select your name
    - Select the specific day you want to work on
    - Choose the times you are available from during the specific day you have chosen
4) Press save
38@ Flexitime.Weekly Schedule for Reminders::
All 3 branches will use the same method. The deadline is every Wednesday at 11:59pm.
The roster will get reviewed every Thursday to ensure all shifts are covered & that there are both 3 & 5plus PA’s for busy shifts. If there are gaps in the roster, we use this time to find cover / followup with team members who have not put or contacted us about their availability. 
On Friday’s, the roster will be created & sent to Bela in the evening.
 
Reminder 1: Monday 4pm = Scheduled email 
Hi Team,
Just a quick reminder to please put your availability up on Flexitime before the deadline, Wednesday 11:59pm”
 
Reminder 2: Tuesday 4pm = Group Messenger (can be more personalised)
“Hi Team,
Just a quick reminder to please put your availability up on Flexitime before the deadline, Wednesday 11:59pm or text me your availability”
 
Reminder 3: Wednesday 10am = Group Messenger (can be more personalised)
“Hi Team,
Just a quick reminder to please put your availability up on Flexitime before the deadline, Wednesday 11:59pm or text me your availability”
 
Thursday: Review the roster
Check if the team members have added their availability on Flexitime. If a team member has not, contact them to do so immediately.
Check if all shifts are covered, if not, identify these shifts and contact the team members to get this covered.
 
Friday: Create the roster & send to Bela
Create the final roster and send it to Bela to review. The deadline to send this is by the evening/
 
Weekend: Review of roster & sent out to the team
During this time, Bela may review the roster & make changes. If he is unable to on Saturday, we must review it ourselves & send the roster to the team on Sunday.

39@ Shift swap.Responsibility in regards to Production:
Production Managers and Assistants are responsible for recording shift swaps.

Production assistant needs to provide information for the following areas: 

Date. 
Time range. 
Employee originally rostered. 
Employee covering shift. Reason for shift swap.
If the Production Assistant has been unable to arrange a replacement for their shift then as the Production Manager you need to contact the other Production Assistants to sort out a replacement.

If the reason you as an Production Manager needs to shift swap is due to an injury or illness then contact Directors immediately. 

Ways to contact the Directors: 
Email Bela/Lila through their Escape Masters email. 
Text or call them on their private number. 
Production Manager needs to provide information for the following areas: 
Date. 
Time range. 
Employee originally rostered. 
Employee covering shift. Reason for shift swap.
If the shift swap can not be worked out between the team of Production Managers and Operations Managers then you need to contact  one of the Directors and tell them why you can not find a replacement Production Manager for your shift and why you need to swap your assigned shift.
39@ Shift swap.Shift Swap:
Swapping your shift is to only be done in case of an emergency, for example. Death in the family, Medical appointments, Illness or injury that affects ability to work, sudden emergency and Family emergency.
All shifts swaps must be communicated via email to the Directors at least 48 hours before the start of the shift that you would like to swap. In the email, you must write a few sentences regarding:
The shift you are intending to swap
The reasons why this swap is necessary
You must cc the colleague that you would like to swap with in the email
Analyse if your colleague is qualified (e.g, have the same knowledge and experience as you) to take over your shift

3@ Checking or creating a booking.Checking or creating booking:
Check if the team already has a booking. If not, create a booking as per below. Please aid groups without a booking with the selection of the experience they would like to do. Use the cube and show them the rooms if they are empty.
To create a booking:
Log into Bookeo
Click on Calendar and select the requested date
Select the activity - Escape Experience, VR, Outdoor Quest
Select desired time by clicking on the slot


If you would like to change the timing of a game from the predefined slot
Press + New sign
Click on timing tab
Select use a custom time and then select the desired time
Press the + New sign
Booking tab
Fill out details on the customers’ details on the Booking tab – make sure you enter the correct number of adults and students
Once info is filled out price can be seen on the right hand side
Discount can also be given by selecting a pre-defined voucher or promotion – this has been set up, based on our current promotions
If you would like to add another discount, you need to click on Additional Items, Adjustments and enter the amount that should be taken of the total price e.g. 10% discount for $88, then enter in the description filled “10% discount for 3 attractions played” and select 1 for quantity and put “-8.8” in the unit price field
Please note, that one of the Directors need to approve this discount.
You can also give a discount for ‘Fastest game’ of the month. Please record “fastest and the month and room and level” in the description. Promotion code can be selected for this discount. Please select the correct promotional code, depending on where they have won the free game.
Customer tab

Notes tab 
Put any important info for our team e.g. birthday party
Also, include the FB picture link
Payments tab
Payment needs to be recorded as well. 
If you make a booking, and no payment is made at the time, you don’t fill anything out at the payment section. In this case, just save the booking. 
If a payment is made at the time of the booking, please select the method
Credit card
Cash
Cheque
Deposit
Voucher
In case of split payments (e.g. cash and card), record each payment

You do not need to record each payment separately, just separate the split payments
Press save to save all the payments

43@ COVID-19.Alert Level 1:
Alert Level 1 - Prepare
Escape Masters will still be operating all services during Alert Level 1, Escape Rooms, Remote Play Escape Games, Outdoor Experience and Virtual Reality.

Measures that need to be applied:
Strict Hand Washing/Hygiene practices must be adhered to.
Ensure that the NZ COVID Tracer QR code poster is visible and on display. Employees are encouraged to scan the QR code.
Sanitation of surfaces must be done thoroughly and often throughout the day.
Board games and puzzles on the lobby tables can return
Ensure that every team member completes the registration on the tablet for contact tracing purposes on top of pre-registration purposes as well. If there are customers waiting in the lobby, ask them to sign in via the NZ COVID Tracer QR code.
Tablets must be disinfected before and after each game
Escape rooms must be disinfected at the end of the day and or as needed throughout the day.
 The Eftpos machine must be disinfected after each team uses it.

If you are sick or have flu-like symptoms:
Stay at home
Contact your doctor or healthline and seek advice on getting COVID-19 testing. If you have been advised to self-isolate, you must do so immediately by staying home and taking safety precautions to avoid close contact with other people
If you need to get tested, get tested. At Alert Level 1, after your test, the testing staff will inform you whether to self-isolate while you wait for your test or not. You must follow their instructions but if you are feeling unwell stay home.
Inform Managing Directors and Operations Manager and keep them updated

If you have been in contact with someone who has been tested Covid-19 Positive:
Stay at home
Contact your doctor or healthline and seek advice on getting COVID-19 testing. If you have been advised to self-isolate, you must do so immediately by staying home and taking safety precautions to avoid close contact with other people
If you need to get tested, get tested. At Alert Level 1, after your test, the testing staff will inform you whether to self-isolate while you wait for your test or not. You must follow their instructions but if you are feeling unwell stay home.
Inform Managing Directors and Operations Manager and keep them updated
43@ COVID-19.Alert Level 2:
Alert Level 2 - Reduce

Escape Masters can re-open to the public if they are adhering to the public health guidance including physical distancing and record keeping.
Employees are required to work from the Escape Masters premises according to the roster unless unable too and has been communicated with the Managing Directors.

Measures that need to be applied:
Physical distancing of 2 metres from the customers and between the groups of different bubbles is required
Strict Hand Washing/Hygiene practices must be adhered to.
Ensure that the NZ COVID Tracer QR code poster is visible and on display. Employees are encouraged to scan the QR code.
Sanitation of surfaces must be done thoroughly and often throughout the day.
Groups of customers are allowed on the premises but cannot exceed more than 100 following public health guidance.
Face masks or covering is allowed but not mandatory in the premises
Board games and puzzles on the lobby tables are to be removed. This reduces the amount of objects that are exposed to the customers touch.
Card payment is encouraged. The Eftpos machine must be disinfected after each team uses it.
Ensure that every team member completes the registration on the tablet for contact tracing purposes on top of pre-registration purposes as well. If there are customers waiting in the lobby, ask them to sign in via the NZ COVID Tracer QR code.
Tablets must be disinfected before and after each game
Escape rooms must be disinfected after each game thoroughly

If you are sick or have flu-like symptoms:
Stay at home
Contact your doctor or healthline and seek advice on getting COVID-19 testing. If you have been advised to self-isolate, you must do so immediately.
If you need to get tested, get tested. At Alert Level 2, after your test, the testing staff will inform you whether to self-isolate while you wait for your test or not. You must follow their instructions but if you are feeling unwell stay home.
Inform Managing Directors and Operations Manager and keep them updated

If you have been in contact with someone who has been tested Covid-19 Positive:
Stay at home
Contact your doctor or healthline and seek advice on getting COVID-19 testing. If you have been advised to self-isolate, you must do so immediately.
If you need to get tested, get tested. At Alert Level 2, after your test, the testing staff will inform you whether to self-isolate while you wait for your test or not. You must follow their instructions but if you are feeling unwell stay home.
Inform Managing Directors and Operations Manager and keep them updated
43@ COVID-19.Alert Level 3:
Alert Level 3 - Restrict

Escape Masters can open but cannot physically interact with customers.
Employees are instructed to stay home in their bubble unless work from home is not possible.
Employees will need to work from Escape Masters premises if they are rostered as 0 or more or if they are hosting a Remote Play Escape Game.

During Alert Level 3, Employees scheduled as 0 or more can work from the Escape Masters premises completing the following tasks:
Answer all the Freshdesk tickets and follow up with the pending tickets.
Contact the customers that have booked to play and encourage them to change to online or to reschedule
Complete trainings that you have missed and retake the previous trainings as a refresher
Analyse and review the current clues. Re create the clue video if there are changes with the puzzle
Analyse and review the escape rooms, identify any issues with the puzzles, clues or props and work on it
Charge all the batteries for the door locks and safes in Escape Masters
Complete the Checklist for the escape rooms as well as of the office supplies
Complete a thorough clean in the storage room and staff room
Complete individual tasks provided by the Operation Manager or Managing Directors
Plan and create videos for the rooms.
Plan and create promotional videos of each room for our website
Manage Trademe items, relist items to sell and list potential items
Manage lost and found items
Update the Work Instructions and Health and Safety Guidelines if appropriate 
Work Other tasks that need to be completed
43@ COVID-19.Alert Level 4:
Alert Level 4 - Lockdown
Businesses are closed except for essential service therefore Escape Masters will not operate during Alert Level 4. 
Employees are instructed to stay home in their bubble unless it is for an essential personal movement.

Bookings, Phone calls, Invoices and Freshdesk tickets to be handled remotely.
Work from home tasks may be necessary to meet contracted hours or Wage Subsidy terms.
Operations Manager or rostered assigned Employee will need to contact bookings during the Alert Level 4 Lockdown to reschedule their bookings or answer any enquiries that they may have.
43@ COVID-19.Covid-19 Aspects:
The following are detailed instructions and suggestions for how we should run depending on the issued Covid-19 Alert level.
This guide will be subjected to change depending on Government Policies regarding the Alert Levels and Business operation.
Level 1 - Prepare (The disease is contained in New Zealand) 
Level 2 - Reduce (The disease is contained, but the risk of community transmission remains)
Level 3 - Restrict (High risk the disease is not contained)
Level 4 - Lockdown (Likely that disease is not contained)

4@ Payment.Sponsorships:
Escape Masters offer a $2 discount to University Clubs that we sponsor. This discount can only be applied if the customer(s) provide their club cards to the Escape Master team. Ensure that the card reflects the current year and that it reflects the copy that Escape Masters has. If not, it is not valid and a discount cannot be offered.
To apply this discount on Bookeo:
Log into Bookeo
Click on Calendar and locate the customers booking
If it has not been added/updated, update the booking to reflect how many students are in the team. Ensure that you cross check with their Student ID cards
Select their booking and press ‘Promotion’
Scroll down and select ‘UNI card $2 off (ESA, ISSA, SSA, AMB, KAC) (UNIcard)
Press the ‘Options’ tab and scroll down to the section at the bottom that references ‘UNI card’ along with the initials of the University Clubs
Identify the University Club that the customer has provided via the club card and select the appropriate Uni card selection. Example: If there are 3 students providing their ESA club card, you will need to select ‘UNI card - ESA’, scroll down and select ‘3’ and press ‘Save’.
Press ‘Save’ to finalise the booking
This will automatically adjust the price. Please DO NOT adjust the price on Bookeo.
4@ Payment.Entertainment Voucher:
Escape Masters provides a 25% discount to teams who provide Entertainment Voucher, specifically for Escape Masters, either physical or via the app. The vouchers are only applicable to groups of 4 to 8 Adults. It is not valid for students or for groups less than 4 or lesser. 
To apply this discount on Bookeo:
Log into Bookeo
Click on Calendar and locate the customers booking
Select their booking and press ‘Promotion’
Scroll down and select ‘Entertainment Book (4+ adults - 25% discount) (Entertainment)’
Press the ‘Options’ tab and tick the ‘Entertainment book deal’ box
Press ‘Save’ to finalise the booking
This will automatically apply the 25% discount. Please DO NOT adjust the price on Bookeo.
4@ Payment.Extra Players:
To add extra players (more than the maximum) on Bookeo:
Log into Bookeo
Click on Calendar and locate the customers booking
Ensure that the amount of team members in the ‘Participants’ section is equal to 8
Press the ‘Options’ tab and scroll down to the ‘Extra Player(s):’ section
Press this option and select the description that best describes the amount of extra team members and participants category
Press ‘Save’ to finalise the booking
This will automatically adjust the price. Please DO NOT adjust the price on Bookeo.
4@ Payment.Maccas Promotion:
Customers who are awarded a Free Day Out / Free Hobby Session reward will need to either print or download their personalised voucher. This must be presented at Escape Masters in order to retrieve 1 Free admission. This Free admission is only valid for 1 person in the team.
To apply this voucher on Bookeo: 
Log into Bookeo
Click on Calendar and locate the customers booking
Select their booking and press ‘Promotion’
Scroll down and select ‘McDonalds Monopoly 2020’
Press the ‘Options’ tab and scroll down to the ‘McDonal’s promo’ section. Press this option and select the option that best describes the customer with the personalised voucher
Press the ‘Booking’ tab and add the Coupon code found on the personalised voucher. Once completed, press apply and ‘Save’ to finalise the booking 
This will automatically apply the 1 Free admission. Please DO NOT adjust the price on Bookeo.
4@ Payment.Payment:
Please check in the booking system if the group has paid already or not. It is your responsibility to take the payments and also check if all players has paid. Some groups do not have to pay on the day as they have got a voucher, gift voucher or have paid online. Please collect the voucher and check if the purchased voucher has the same number of players as the number of players at the game. 

If there are more players, ask them to pay for their ticket. If there are less players, please refund in case of online payment only.
4@ Payment.Promotions and discounts: You can give discounts to customers according to the Escape Masters guideline. The promotions and discounts are recorded in ‘All Branches Info google sheet, where you can check the promotion and discount as well as what is required by the customer to receive the discount.

5@ Introducing players.Introducing players to the Escape Master:
Not everyone has played an escape game or an an escape game at Escape Masters, VR Game or have done an Outdoor Quest before.  Please explain a bit about the three games on offer to those people that have never played one of the games before.
Now I would like to explain to you a bit about the three type of games on offer. 
Escape Room experience is an adventure for teams that are locked in a themed room and the team have to use objects from around the room, find clues and solve puzzles.To escape and break out of the room within an hour.

VR game experience explore virtual reality where you interact with the artificial world. The choice of 15-20 games with different genres shooting, escape rooms, sport action, dancing and arcade style games. 

Outdoor Quest experience is an outdoor adventure around Auckland CBD where you and your team have 2 hours where you need to find and figure out clues and puzzles in and around downtown Auckland starting and finishing at Escape Masters Limited.

6@ Before staring the game.Check the game level:
Check the level to make sure that the room is set up correctly. 
You will need to confirm the level of the game (and the game as well) before you put them in the room.
Make sure that teams play the appropriate level of the game. (2-3 pp = easy, 3-5 pp = medium, 5-8 pp = hard 8 pp or experienced groups = x-hard) Group of kids easy or medium.


For example, a group of under 14 years trying play on hard level. You know each room and you can talk to the players, so use your best judgment.
You will be playing on /Level/. The best time is /minutes/ on the level you will be playing on. If you think that they are not suited for the level they have booked, please advise them.
6@ Before staring the game.Escape Games:
Not everyone has played an escape game before. Please explain a bit about the game to those people that have never played before.
Now I would like to explain to you a bit about the game.

Escape Masters is an adventure, where teams are locked in a themed room and their common goal is to break out within an hour. To escape, you will have to use objects from around the room, find clues and solve puzzles! It is a room filled with brain teasers, tricky riddles, locks, keys and a lot of fun. 

Ask players if they have a strategy
Do you have a strategy?
Good strategy: Preparation, effective teamwork, communications, good organization, curiosity, modesty and good mood ☺ 
Bad strategy: You are late, you don’t pay attention, you want to solve everything by yourself, team is not communicating so everything is checked 3 times, you rush, you are impatient, you work on one problem for a long time and you forget to ask for help. 

Make sure that all the players have the rules and understand what they can and cannot do in the escape rooms. Please highlight what to do in case of emergency and how they can call you if they need immediate assistance.
6.7.2. 	Outdoor escape game
Not everyone has played an escape game before. Please explain a bit about the game to those people that have never played before. Players have to search downtown Auckland for clues and puzzles to find out who the mystery bag belongs to. Would you be able to do it?

Please ensure that all the rules have been read. Make sure that they pay attention to traffic rules and have our phone number to call us in case of emergency.
6.7.3. 	VR Games
Not everyone has played VR before. Please explain a bit about VR to those people that have never played before.
Now I would like to explain to you a bit about the VR. 
Challenge yourself with our new HTC VIVE Virtual Reality games. With numerous games to choose from, this technology gives you the opportunity to immerse yourself in imaginary environments. All you need is to put the headset on and hold the controllers and you are ready for another world. Experience Virtual Reality now!
Ask players if they have any questions.
Make sure that all the players have the rules and understand what they can and cannot do in the VR game area. Please highlight what to do in case of emergency and how they can call you if they need immediate assistance. Makes sure that they understand if they break the equipment they are liable for paying for the damage.

7@ Starting the experience.Escape Game:
7.1.1. Getting players started with the tablet
Get a tablet and create the game session with her/his pin.  Or use their personal QR code. Once logged in, it will take you to the Welcome view.  At this stage you must hand the tablet over to customer group. They will be able to choose the language preferred before pressing “Let your experience begin” button.
Instruct the players to follow the instructions they see on the tablet and to fill in the necessary details (Team Name, Name and Selfie). Once submitted, player sign in page will come next. 
There are three different ways to sign in:
1)    With an account  (‘Sign in’ button)
The customer can create an account to login (An email address is needed in order to create an account) Or she/he can use an existing account to login, Or she/he can use a social media account to login (Facebook)
2)    Without an account (‘Register’ button)
The customer can create a one time visitor account by pressing the Check in button. The only mandatory field is the name.
3)‘ I Booked It ‘
The customer who created the booking can take legal responsibility for the whole team. However, all parties must be aware and must agree to this.


 This is more beneficial for larger groups. When this option is chosen, the customer taking legal responsibility must do one of the two options.
Customer can fill out the customer information page and tick ‘returning customer’ and enter their password. Once completed they can tick the box on the bottom that allows them to take legal responsibility of the whole team. Once completed they can press submit to progress.

Customer can fill out the customer information page and tick ‘One time’. Once completed they can tick the box on the bottom that allows them to take legal responsibility of the whole team. Once completed they can press submit to progress. 
ALL players are required to complete this, as it means that the players understand the rules and regulations. So please tell all the players that we need at least all the players’ name. However, it is highly recommend to create an account with us in the app, so we can send the their pictures and inform them of free games and other future deals. And please do not use any fake email address (just register as one time visitor)!
Tell the customers we will only send one email; we will not spam their inbox. This is because we mail them the pictures that we take at the end of the game and the selfies they take for free.  Politely ask (encourage) them to put down their emails. 
7.1.2. Introducing players to the game rules in the tablet
Ensure that all players read the rules and confirm it by checking the tablet. 		Please try to answer any questions that they might have regarding the game.  
Do you have any questions? 


7.1.3. Escorting players to the game room, showing around the room, informing players about the health and safety rules and procedures
Are you ready to start the game?  Check the tablet to see if the team has read the games rules, health and safety introduction, and escape room story. If this has not been done ask the team to please read these and tick all of the boxes once having read these. 
Are you ready to start the game? Please follow me. Now take the team into their room, bring the tablet along and show them where they can put their stuff…in the black box. Show the players the location of the camera, the countdown clock and the door they need to escape from. 
Emphasize to customers ( especially for customers in the bank heist rooms).
That the cameras are there for security and safety reasons and so staff can see how you are doing in escaping the room. The cameras have nothing to do with the game so please leave them alone when you are escaping. Ask teams in Alien not to climb or stand on the ramps.
Explain how all clues are in the room, however there are no clues under the carpet, ceiling, wall, or the air conditioner, props, picture or decorations on the walls. So players can leave these areas alone because they will not find any clues there. 
Point out the emergency button in the tablet and doors. Show players how the emergency doors work and indicated to them where the closest fire escape route is. 
In case of emergency please use the emergency door or key or press the call button. 


If you hear the fire alarm, please stop everything and leave the room through the emergency door. Leave the building at the closes escape route and meet our team in front of the assembly point.
You must ensure that all players leave the room in case of emergency. 
Explain to players that they should not stand in front of the end exit doors of the escape rooms, especially the end exit door of Bank heist 1 and 2 . Because the players inside could hit anyone that is on the other side of the door when they are rushing to escape the room. 
For your safety please remember: 
DO NOT force things, everything can be opened with a combination. 
DO NOT climb on top of chairs. 
DO NOT pull the shelving / furniture on yourself or other players. 
Please be gentle with props and design elements.
Do not check behind the fake ceiling. 
Please do not disconnect the camera or the timer. We had a player disconnect the camera as he was running out time…no, this will not give you more time, so do not unplug the timer.
Be careful with trying digital combinations as if you get the wrong code multiple times, it will start beeping and will not be able to enter the correct code for couple of minutes. 
Any questions?

7.1.4. 	Introducing escape game concept
Explain to the players what they will be doing. “You will need to find clues, solve puzzles, crack codes and escape the room. There are multiple puzzles in the room and you can work on them at the same time…the room is not a linear setup.” You might want to point out a lock for the players to show them what they would need to open.
7.1.5 	Use of the tablet in the game room
Explain to them how the tablet works. Tell them about the notes that they can make in the tablet. Tell them about the three clues they get during the game and how they can scan the QR codes for clues. Make sure to tell them that they need to scan the QR code outside the escape room after they exit through the locked door asap to record their accurate escape time.
Start the timer in the tablet and the room clock at the same time. 

“This tablet will stay with you in the room during the game. You can take down notes in this tablet. You get three clues during the game and can use them if you are stuck with any puzzle. Just press the tab (scan QR clues) and scan the QR code of the puzzle that you need the help with. Please make sure you carry the tablet with you when you escape through the exit door and scan the QR code outside the room to record your accurate escape time. This will also show you the team rank and if you are the fastest team of the month.”
7.1.6 	Introducing the story
Tell the players the relevant story. The story can be read on the tablet as well, but a short recap should be mentioned before starting the game to set the scene. For example for the Bank Heist you could say: Are you ready to rob the Bank of Escape Masters to save your friend? Get going and do what needs to be done! See you soon with all the money you can gather, but remember, you only have 60 minutes to escape.
Start the timer in the tablet and the room clock at the same time.
Say: Have fun and good luck! And exit the room. 
Make sure that the door is closed (and the end-door is locked) on them.
