18@ Managing customer queries.Managing customer queries in Freshdesk:
https://escapemasters.freshdesk.com/a/dashboard/default
Please log in everyday and monitor the emails.
Type into browser: escapemasters.freshdesk.com/agent. Use your login details to log in.
Once you logged in…
 1st login:
Click on getting started tab.
Solve your first ticket – watch the video.
Ignore ‘create a view’ and ‘macro’
Everyday use:
On the left hand side, you will see the tickets. It is under the view menu.
You do not need to assign a ticket unless you cannot solve it. If you cannot solve it, please assign it to Lilla.
To view a ticket, click on it.
Read the ticket.
Type your reply in the “Public Reply” box.
You can attach a file, by pressing the attach file icon.
Once you are ready to send the ticket (email), submit it by the ‘submit’ button. You must select ‘Open’, ‘Pending’ or ‘Solved’ when you submit the ticket. If you select any of these an email will go out.

New = If you select this, the ticket will stay as new in the list, although you have replied to it. PLEASE NEVER SELECT THIS!
Open = It will show that one of us is already working on the email
Pending = It will show that we are waiting for request or reply. Please use this if you reply to a customer BOOKING QUERY and you have not made the bookings for this group. Once the booking is made, email the customer and change the ticket to closed.
Solved = It will show that the ticket has been solved. Don’t need to take action it. Please select this if you answer all the queries and if booking is needed you have made the booking.
Please revisit pending tickets.

Check pending tickets that are a week old (or older)
Call the contacts for the pending tickets. Ask them how you can help to make the booking.
Ensure once a booking is made relating to a ticket, you change the status to closed from pending.
You can search for closed tickets in the ‘recently solved ticket’ view.
You can search for a person with the search button.
You will need to use the refresh button to refresh the page and get new tickets.

Sample email:
Dear XY,

Thank you for your interest in Escape Masters!

Escape Masters, New Zealand’s first real-life escape game, is a new team building activity, where teams are locked in a themed room with a unique mystery, and all the participants must work together to solve the brainteasers and tricky riddles, open locks and find keys to escape the room within an hour.
This internationally popular phenomenon promises a vivid experience where you and your team can become the main characters of a captivating mystery.
This game requires critical thinking and tests your mettle on other important skills you and your team need in life in a fun and exciting environment. You will need to build a strategy, plan your moves, manage your time, share the work and cooperate. 
You will also need to think outside of the box, be creative, be innovative. The rooms have been designed to build genuine connections with the participants from the same or different teams. And for competitive groups with 4-16 players, you can pit two teams against each other by starting the teams simultaneously in our identically-themed rooms.
Escape Masters is the perfect place for your company, whether it’s to clear the air, or as a booster to revitalise your workplace relationships at your next team event. 
We offer four difficulty levels for our six rooms, and they can all be accessed in one convenient location in the heart of Wellington City. You can be certain your fun won’t be spoiled by the weather; we open rain or shine from 10:00 am to 11:00 pm every day of the year. Each room can have a maximum of 8 players in them, which means you can have up to 48 people playing at once. 
Arranging meals for your function will be easy and we also offer a wide selection of non-alcoholic drinks at a very friendly price. 
Our spacious lobby area is available for drinks and food, and your team is free to warm-up or cool-down there before this sensational challenge.
Rest assured, there is an emergency exit in each room, so it’s perfectly safe and no one will jump out to give you a fright.
[For more specific information on pricing]

The prices vary depending on the number of players in a room, but will range from $25 -$38. With a group of x players, it would be best to book Y rooms with x, x and x players. A room with X-X players will come to $X per room, therefore X rooms will come to $X.

Suitable for all ages, Escape Masters is the perfect venue for corporate functions, so don’t miss out on the best and the most unforgettable team building experience in Wellington!
We would love to have your team here at Escape Masters. Feel free to get in touch if you would like to have more information or would like to book your next team event with us.

Please find our flyer attached.

Kind regards,
XY

20@ Invoicing.Refund:
Escape Masters refund policy:
Once a game is paid, no refunds are available.
Customers will not be refunded if they are refused an entry due to being under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
Customers will not be refunded if they are removed from the game because they did not act according to the game rules, and/or they were at risk to others, and/or their behaviour was inappropriate according to the Escape Masters Team
However, in some cases we might give a refund. All refunds have to be approved by the Manager or one of the Directors.
Escape Masters refund process:
Investigate why a refund is needed 
Check the amount
Request approval for refund from Operations Manager or one of the Directors
Establish if cash or bank transfer refund is needed
If bank transfer refund is needed, please take the bank account number of the customer
Do not change the number of people in the bookeo as it will change the Xero invoice too. The customer already paid for 6 people, so we need an invoice that reflects the payment. Leave the number of people as is in Bookeo. For Ex : a Booking for 6 people but only 5 turn up. You give a refund for one player, create a credit note in Xero for the refund, and do not change the number of of people in bookeo. Mention the refund in the Bookeo notes as well. 
Create a credit note for the refund:
Cash refund: 
Select New Credit note
Fill out all the fields
In the reference field enter the invoice number that you are giving a cash refund on 
then press “approve” 
Fill out the amount credited and from which account (sales). 
Press save. 
Fill out the details for “make a cash refund” – Paid from field is (Wellington/Auckland/Rotorua Cash) 
Press add refund. Do not press allocate a credit note.
Bank transfer refund: 
Select New Credit note
Fill out all the field 
In the reference field enter the invoice number that you are giving a cash refund on
Fill out amount credited and from which account (sales)
Press save. Do not press allocate a credit note.
If bank transfer refund is needed, email credit note, and reason for refund to both of the Directors.
If a bank transfer refund is needed, inform the customer that the refund has been approved and it will shortly be credited to their account.
20@ Invoicing.Stock invoicing:
Damaged or expired stock must be returned to the company it was purchased from. For example, a damaged or expired coke must be returned to Coke Company. You will have to contact them to pick up the damaged or expired coke and get a refund invoice.
However, if a staff member is responsible for damaging the stock, they are responsible and must pay for it. In this case, this damaged stock must be invoiced as a normal purchase.

21@ Depositing money.Depositing Money:
At the end of every round of games if there is more than $200 in the cash box, and if there are no customers, you should deposit cash from the cash box into the safe in storage. For safety purposes, money should be counted in the store room and not in plain sight where customers or the public can see it. There should only be a maximum of $200 in the cash box.
Please check the amount of money in the safe and the cash box at the end of your shift. You should only leave a maximum of $200 in the cash box and $1000 in the safe. 
Please deposit any excess money from the safe into the ASB bank account during the day time.
Please ensure that there is enough from each note and change can be given from it. If there are not enough coins, please go to the bank or a store to exchange a note for coins.
All excess change should be placed in the safe.

How to deposit money at the ASB ATM: 

Insert the deposit card like a normal eftpos card however you can only deposit money into the account. Enter the pin code for this card which is Bela’s birth year. 
Select the cheque account to deposit the money in. Insert the cash into the machine. Confirm the amount deposited. Type your name as the reference so the directors know who deposited the money. Retrieve the deposit card and receipt and place it back into the safe. 

Depositing Cheque: 

Take the cheque to a teller at an ASB Bank on Willis Street.  Give the account number to the teller: 12-3066-0499995-02 and also give them the cheque.

27@ Managment aspects.Cash purchases: All invoices must be scanned and sent to Bela. However, if money is taken out for any purchase of Escape Masters, you must scan the invoice right away and send it to marta@escapemasters.co.nz

28@ Handling customer concerns.Compensation:
You will need to use your best judgment as to how to compensate a group. You may only need to apologise to them or promise that our process will be changed. However, sometimes a little bit more is needed. You can give a discount for their second game or give a free game to the group.
A free game could be given for compensation if a game was significantly incorrectly set up and it ruined the experience..
You will need to record any compensation given in the Shared sheet’s Customer complaint tab.
28@ Handling customer concerns.Customer complaint handling:
It is vital to handle customer complaints well. You can receive a customer complaint in person or in writing. All verbal and written customer complaints must be dealt with as soon as the complaint is received. Please follow the below guideline to best handle the situation.
You will need to handle all customer complaints in a professional manner. You will need to have a customer-first attitude and handle all complaints in this manner. 
Keep calm: Remain in control of your emotions, stay calm and professional. 
Listen to the customer: Allow the customer to explain the issue in detail, without interruption.
 “I see; could you please explain the situation to me in detail?” Get as much information as possible, so ask questions if the issues are not clarified for you.
Acknowledge the issue: Make the customer aware that you understand the situation. “If I understand you correctly ....(restate the problem here).” 
Apologise or explain misunderstanding: If you or any of your teammates have made a mistake, apologies for it. “I am really sorry about the situation.” If it is a misunderstanding, please respectfully explain the situation. “I can see how that would be frustrating for you. (now explain the misunderstanding)”
Offer a solution: Please keep in mind Escape Master’s policies when offering a solution. Offer an appropriate solution to the customer and let them know what you will do. “Based on the details of the situation this is what I can offer to you / this is what I will do…”
Check solution with the customer: Once a solution is offered, check with the customer to see if they are happy with the solution. “Would you say the solution proposed would work for you?”
Thank them for their cooperation: After you have offered a solution check with the customer if they find the solution appropriate. “Thank you for understanding and we hope to see you again!”
Act upon the promise: Take ownership of the issue and make sure you act upon what you have promised. 
Inform the team: By informing the team (incl. manager and directors) you are allowing us to review the situation and implement better processes for the future and learn from the mistakes, so they are not repeated again. 
Follow up call: Please call the customer to follow up on the situation and check if they are happy with the solution.

2@ Meeting and greeting players.Escape game:

Welcome /Team Name/ to Escape Masters! My name is <XY>.
Have you played an Escape Game before? Live or online? If they have been here, what game did they play and how do they like it? Do you have any strategies for the game?  - converse a little on this topic. If they have not played a game before, explain about the game. An internationally popular phenomenon, where teams are locked in a themed room with a common goal to break-out. You will need to find clues and solve puzzles that are in the room to be able to escape within an hour. We have 6 rooms and 5 experiences. 
Introduce our other branches. We have branches in Manukau, Auckland, Rotorua and Wellington.

Players have to search downtown Wellington for clues and puzzles to find out who the mystery bag belongs to. Would you be able to do it?

36@ Taking breaks.Taking Breaks:
You will need to be flexible as to when you can take the break. The most important thing is to keep our customers safe and follow our Health and Safety rules. Below you can find a guideline as to how you can take a break.
One 10-minute paid rest break during a work period of between 2 hours and 4 hours;
One 10-minute paid rest break and one 30-minute meal break during a work period of between 4 hours and 6 hours
Two 10-minute paid rest breaks and one 30-minute meal break during a work period of between 6 hours and 8 hours; and
If an employee works for a period of more than 8 hours, the requirements apply as if their work period had started again at the end of the eighth hour. 
You will need to record the breaks you take in Flexitime. Record your break duration.
Please note the below important rules:
You cannot take a break when there is a game in process and you are working alone. You may take a break when there is a game in process, but only when there is someone else with you on the shift - so that person can monitor the game. 
You cannot take a break when it’s very busy (e.g. games are starting, 3 or more rooms are going at the same time, games are finishing or rooms need to be reset).
The Operations Manager or the Production Manager has the right to call for a second or a third person with them during their shift if there is a need.

37@ Uniforms.Uniforms:
Uniforms
You will need to wear a uniform at all times. You will need to ensure that the uniform is clean and wrinkle free. The uniform can be the Escape Masters T-shirt or the Escape Masters hoodie. No hats or beanies are allowed. Footwear should have a closed toe e.g. sneakers, boots. No open toe shoes e.g slides, flip flops/ jandals.

38@ Flexitime.Clock in and out: Please use Flexitime to clock in/out when you arrive/leave.				 We cannot accept any other late recordings.

Each week the deadline for submitting your available hours to work is every Wednesday  by 11:59 PM. 
This must be done each week before the deadline time and anything after the deadline will not be added.
How to submit your available hours:
1) Log onto flexitime
2) Click on the calendar and choose the date that you are putting in your availability for
3) Click on record time 
    - Select your name
    - Select the specific day you want to work on
    - Choose the times you are available from during the specific day you have chosen
4) Press save

39@ Shift swap.Shift Swap:
Swapping your shift is to only be done in case of an emergency, for example. Death in the family, Medical appointments, Illness or injury that affects ability to work, sudden emergency and Family emergency.

The reasons why this swap is necessary

3@ Checking or creating a booking.Checking or creating booking:
Check if the team already has a booking. If not, create a booking as per below. Please aid groups without a booking with the selection of the experience they would like to do. Use the cube and show them the rooms if they are empty.
To create a booking:
Log into Bookeo
Click on Calendar and select the requested date
Select the activity - Escape Experience, VR, Outdoor Quest
Select desired time by clicking on the slot


If you would like to change the timing of a game from the predefined slot
Press + New sign
Click on timing tab
Select use a custom time and then select the desired time
Press the + New sign
Booking tab
Fill out details on the customers’ details on the Booking tab – make sure you enter the correct number of adults and students
Once info is filled out price can be seen on the right hand side
Discount can also be given by selecting a pre-defined voucher or promotion – this has been set up, based on our current promotions
If you would like to add another discount, you need to click on Additional Items, Adjustments and enter the amount that should be taken of the total price e.g. 10% discount for $88, then enter in the description filled “10% discount for 3 attractions played” and select 1 for quantity and put “-8.8” in the unit price field
Please note, that one of the Directors need to approve this discount.
You can also give a discount for ‘Fastest game’ of the month. Please record “fastest and the month and room and level” in the description. Promotion code can be selected for this discount. Please select the correct promotional code, depending on where they have won the free game.

Notes tab 
Put any important info for our team e.g. birthday party
Also, include the FB picture link
Payments tab
Payment needs to be recorded as well.

Deposit
Voucher

43@ COVID-19.Alert Level 1:
Alert Level 1 - Prepare
Escape Masters will still be operating all services during Alert Level 1, Escape Rooms, Remote Play Escape Games, Outdoor Experience and Virtual Reality.

Measures that need to be applied:
Strict Hand Washing/Hygiene practices must be adhered to.
Ensure that the NZ COVID Tracer QR code poster is visible and on display. Employees are encouraged to scan the QR code.
Sanitation of surfaces must be done thoroughly and often throughout the day.
Board games and puzzles on the lobby tables can return
Ensure that every team member completes the registration on the tablet for contact tracing purposes on top of pre-registration purposes as well. If there are customers waiting in the lobby, ask them to sign in via the NZ COVID Tracer QR code.
Tablets must be disinfected before and after each game
Escape rooms must be disinfected at the end of the day and or as needed throughout the day.
 The Eftpos machine must be disinfected after each team uses it.

If you are sick or have flu-like symptoms:
Stay at home
Contact your doctor or healthline and seek advice on getting COVID-19 testing. If you have been advised to self-isolate, you must do so immediately by staying home and taking safety precautions to avoid close contact with other people
If you need to get tested, get tested. At Alert Level 1, after your test, the testing staff will inform you whether to self-isolate while you wait for your test or not. You must follow their instructions but if you are feeling unwell stay home.
Inform Managing Directors and Operations Manager and keep them updated

If you have been in contact with someone who has been tested Covid-19 Positive:
Stay at home
Contact your doctor or healthline and seek advice on getting COVID-19 testing. If you have been advised to self-isolate, you must do so immediately by staying home and taking safety precautions to avoid close contact with other people
If you need to get tested, get tested. At Alert Level 1, after your test, the testing staff will inform you whether to self-isolate while you wait for your test or not. You must follow their instructions but if you are feeling unwell stay home.
Inform Managing Directors and Operations Manager and keep them updated

43@ COVID-19.Alert Level 3:
Alert Level 3 - Restrict

Escape Masters can open but cannot physically interact with customers.
Employees are instructed to stay home in their bubble unless work from home is not possible.
Employees will need to work from Escape Masters premises if they are rostered as 0 or more or if they are hosting a Remote Play Escape Game.

During Alert Level 3, Employees scheduled as 0 or more can work from the Escape Masters premises completing the following tasks:
Answer all the Freshdesk tickets and follow up with the pending tickets.
Contact the customers that have booked to play and encourage them to change to online or to reschedule
Complete trainings that you have missed and retake the previous trainings as a refresher

Analyse and review the escape rooms, identify any issues with the puzzles, clues or props and work on it
Charge all the batteries for the door locks and safes in Escape Masters
Complete the Checklist for the escape rooms as well as of the office supplies
Complete a thorough clean in the storage room and staff room
Complete individual tasks provided by the Operation Manager or Managing Directors
Plan and create videos for the rooms.
Plan and create promotional videos of each room for our website
Manage Trademe items, relist items to sell and list potential items
Manage lost and found items
Update the Work Instructions and Health and Safety Guidelines if appropriate 
Work Other tasks that need to be completed

Businesses are closed except for essential service therefore Escape Masters will not operate during Alert Level 4. 
Employees are instructed to stay home in their bubble unless it is for an essential personal movement.

Bookings, Phone calls, Invoices and Freshdesk tickets to be handled remotely.

Level 1 - Prepare (The disease is contained in New Zealand)

5@ Introducing players.Introducing players to the Escape Master:
Not everyone has played an escape game or an an escape game at Escape Masters, VR Game or have done an Outdoor Quest before.  Please explain a bit about the three games on offer to those people that have never played one of the games before.
Now I would like to explain to you a bit about the three type of games on offer. 
Escape Room experience is an adventure for teams that are locked in a themed room and the team have to use objects from around the room, find clues and solve puzzles.To escape and break out of the room within an hour.

VR game experience explore virtual reality where you interact with the artificial world. The choice of 15-20 games with different genres shooting, escape rooms, sport action, dancing and arcade style games. 

Outdoor Quest experience is an outdoor adventure around Auckland CBD where you and your team have 2 hours where you need to find and figure out clues and puzzles in and around downtown Auckland starting and finishing at Escape Masters Limited.

6@ Before staring the game.Check the game level:
Check the level to make sure that the room is set up correctly. 
You will need to confirm the level of the game (and the game as well) before you put them in the room.
Make sure that teams play the appropriate level of the game. (2-3 pp = easy, 3-5 pp = medium, 5-8 pp = hard 8 pp or experienced groups = x-hard) Group of kids easy or medium.


For example, a group of under 14 years trying play on hard level. You know each room and you can talk to the players, so use your best judgment.
You will be playing on /Level/. The best time is /minutes/ on the level you will be playing on. If you think that they are not suited for the level they have booked, please advise them.
6@ Before staring the game.Escape Games:
Not everyone has played an escape game before. Please explain a bit about the game to those people that have never played before.
Now I would like to explain to you a bit about the game.

Escape Masters is an adventure, where teams are locked in a themed room and their common goal is to break out within an hour. To escape, you will have to use objects from around the room, find clues and solve puzzles! It is a room filled with brain teasers, tricky riddles, locks, keys and a lot of fun. 

Ask players if they have a strategy
Do you have a strategy?
Good strategy: Preparation, effective teamwork, communications, good organization, curiosity, modesty and good mood ☺ 
Bad strategy: You are late, you don’t pay attention, you want to solve everything by yourself, team is not communicating so everything is checked 3 times, you rush, you are impatient, you work on one problem for a long time and you forget to ask for help. 

Make sure that all the players have the rules and understand what they can and cannot do in the escape rooms. Please highlight what to do in case of emergency and how they can call you if they need immediate assistance.
6.7.2. 	Outdoor escape game
Not everyone has played an escape game before. Please explain a bit about the game to those people that have never played before. Players have to search downtown Auckland for clues and puzzles to find out who the mystery bag belongs to. Would you be able to do it?

Please ensure that all the rules have been read. Make sure that they pay attention to traffic rules and have our phone number to call us in case of emergency.
6.7.3. 	VR Games
Not everyone has played VR before. Please explain a bit about VR to those people that have never played before.
Now I would like to explain to you a bit about the VR. 
Challenge yourself with our new HTC VIVE Virtual Reality games. With numerous games to choose from, this technology gives you the opportunity to immerse yourself in imaginary environments. All you need is to put the headset on and hold the controllers and you are ready for another world. Experience Virtual Reality now!
Ask players if they have any questions.
Make sure that all the players have the rules and understand what they can and cannot do in the VR game area. Please highlight what to do in case of emergency and how they can call you if they need immediate assistance. Makes sure that they understand if they break the equipment they are liable for paying for the damage.

7@ Starting the experience.Escorting players to the game room, show:
Are you ready to start the game?  Check the tablet to see if the team has read the games rules, health and safety introduction, and escape room story. 

If this has not been done ask the team to please read these and tick all of the boxes once having read these. 

Are you ready to start the game? Please follow me. Now take the team into their room, bring the tablet along and show them where they can put their stuff (in the black box).

Emphasize to customers that the cameras are there for security and safety reasons and so staff can see how you are doing in escaping the room. The cameras have nothing to do with the game so please leave them alone when you are escaping.

Explain how all clues are in the room, however there are no clues under the carpet, ceiling, wall, or the air conditioner, props, picture or decorations on the walls. So players can leave these areas alone because they will not find any clues there.  

Point out the emergency button in the tablet and doors. Show players how the emergency doors work and indicate to them where the closest fire escape route is. 

In case of emergency please use the emergency door or key or press the call button. 

If you hear the fire alarm, please stop everything and leave the room through the emergency door. Leave the building at the closest escape route and meet our team in front of the assembly point.

You must ensure that all players leave the room in case of emergency. 

For your safety please remember: 

DO NOT force things, everything can be opened with a combination. 

DO NOT climb on top of chairs. 

DO NOT pull the shelving / furniture on yourself or other players. 

Please be gentle with props and design elements.

Do not check behind the fake ceiling. 

Please do not disconnect the camera or the timer. We had a player disconnect the camera as he was running out time…no, this will not give you more time, so do not unplug the timer.

Be careful with trying digital combinations as if you get the wrong code multiple times, it will start beeping and will not be able to enter the correct code for a couple of minutes. 

Any questions?
7@ Starting the experience.Getting players started with the tablet:
Get a tablet and create the game session with her/his pin.  Or use their personal QR code. Once logged in, it will take you to the Welcome view.  At this stage you must hand the tablet over to the customer group. They will be able to choose the language preferred before pressing the “Let your experience begin” button.

Instruct the players to follow the instructions they see on the tablet and to fill in the necessary details (Team Name, Name and Selfie). Once submitted, the player sign in page will come next. 

There are three different ways to sign in:

1)    With an account  (‘Sign in’ button)

The customer can create an account to login (An email address is needed in order to create an account) Or she/he can use an existing account to login, Or she/he can use a social media account to login (Facebook)

2)    Without an account (‘Register’ button)

The customer can create a one time visitor account by pressing the Check in button. The only mandatory field is the name.

3)‘ I Booked It ‘

The customer who created the booking can take legal responsibility for the whole team. However, all parties must be aware and must agree to this.

 This is more beneficial for larger groups. When this option is chosen, the customer taking legal responsibility must do one of the two options.

  • Customer can fill out the customer information page and tick ‘returning customers’ and enter their password. Once completed they can tick the box on the bottom that allows them to take legal responsibility of the whole team. Once completed they can press submit to progress.

  • Customer can fill out the customer information page and tick ‘One time’. Once completed they can tick the box on the bottom that allows them to take legal responsibility of the whole team. Once completed they can press submit to progress. 

ALL players are required to complete this, as it means that the players understand the rules and regulations. So please tell all the players that we need at least all the players’ names. However, it is highly recommended to create an account with us in the app, so we can send their pictures and inform them of free games and other future deals. And please do not use any fake email address (just register as one time visitor)!

Tell the customers we will only send one email; we will not spam their inbox. This is because we mail them the pictures that we take at the end of the game and the selfies they take for free.  Politely ask (encourage) them to put down their emails.
7@ Starting the experience.Introducing escape game concept: ​Explain to the players what they will be doing. “You will need to find clues, solve puzzles, crack codes and escape the room. There are multiple puzzles in the room and you can work on them at the same time…the room is not a linear setup.” You might want to point out a lock for the players to show them what they would need to open.​
7@ Starting the experience.Introducing players to the game rules in:
Ensure that all players read the rules and confirm it by checking the tablet. Please try to answer any questions that they might have regarding the game. 

Do you have any questions?
7@ Starting the experience.Introducing the story:
Tell the players the relevant story. The story can be read on the tablet as well, but a short recap should be mentioned before starting the game to set the scene. For example for the Serial Killer room you could say: Are you ready to escape the clutches of the local Serial Killer? You must get out of here quickly before they return! Remember, you only have 60 minutes to escape.

Start the timer on the tablet.

Say: Have fun and good luck! And exit the room. 

Make sure that the door is closed (and the end-door is locked) on them.
7@ Starting the experience.Starting the Outdoor quest experience:
Make sure that all the rules have been read and understood. 

Rule sheets are located on the wall of the lobby. 

Ask if customers have a camera with them as they need to take pictures for evidence that they went to specific places. 

Please check if the games have been reset correctly and then hand over the bag to the team. Offer umbrellas and sunscreen to customers.  

Make sure you check the time and let the team know that they have 2 hours now to complete the mission
7@ Starting the experience.Use of the tablet in the game room:
Explain to them how the tablet works. Tell them about the notes that they can make on the tablet. Tell them about the three clues they get during the game and how they can scan the QR codes for clues. Make sure to tell them that they need to scan the QR code outside the escape room after they exit through the locked door asap to record their accurate escape time.

Start the timer on the tablet.

“This tablet will stay with you in the room during the game. You can take down notes in this tablet. You get three clues during the game and can use them if you are stuck with any puzzle. Just press the tab (scan QR clues) and scan the QR code of the puzzle that you need the help with. Please make sure you carry the tablet with you when you escape through the exit door and scan the QR code outside the room to record your accurate escape time. This will also show you the team rank and if you are the fastest team of the month.”

8@ Duties while customers play.Monitoring players and giving help:
Escape game

Monitor the players and watch them to make sure they are safe and not causing any harm to themselves or the property. Players normally ask for help through the tablet. Should they need any other help, they can call the staff with the emergency call button in the tablet. This button is the SOS button which is located on the top right hand side of the tablet.You need to go into the room and check what they need help with and enter your code in, so a help given is registered.scan that clue, so the help gets counted. 8.1.3 VR gameMake sure the the equipment is used correctly. Ensure that there is only one player per booth. Watch the players and advise them if they need to change anything on how they use the equipment. Also, please help them during the game if needed.​
8@ Duties while customers play.Outdoor Quest:
Please make sure that they are back within 120 minutes. 

If they are more than 10 minutes late, please give them a call to make sure that they are safe. Give them help on how to get back to Escape Masters.

There are no clues given to players during the quest.

9@ Congratulating players.Escape game:
If the players finish in 60 minutes:

Make sure when the team escapes, they scan their QR code. Let them check their ranking. Congratulate them and ask: how was the game? What did they like? 

Are they interested to find things that they have not or solve puzzles that they were not sure about? – in this case show them the clues and how to solve these puzzles.
9@ Congratulating players.Outdoor quest:
Make sure the teams get back on time. Congratulations to them on their performance. Check the Evidence Submission sheet and count their points. 

The answer sheet is located in the side desk second draw near the fridge.

Simply add together all the points for all the correct answers. Announce the results and congratulate the winners. The staff member needs to rip up the answer sheet that customers used and bin it after showing customers what their score was.
9@ Congratulating players.Remote Play Game:
If the players finish in 60 minutes:
Make sure that when the team has escaped, that you scan the QR code. Let them check their ranking. Congratulate them and converse with them about their experience, out of the room and in the lobby, and ask: how was the game? What did they like, if they have any suggestions? How can we improve?
